title: I doubted the Ekko hate...
body:
I doubt no longer. Just laned against him for the first time and while I agree it's an absurdly small sample, spending 20 minutes trying to dodge his Q, stay out of range of his E dash,  not get caught in his W which is a slow+stun+shield, AND keeping track of his veigar-like ulti.....

Someone in RD needs to be fired. How a champ with literally every conceivable ability in his kit WITH super high ratios is beyond me. 

How? Just how? I don't get it. I thought people play-tested these things to see how it was BEFORE release. Did we skip that phase of the process this time?

I did this for another thread like this, so I'll do it for yours now too.  I pulled the OP.GG stats for the game referenced by the OP to find out how it went.  I'm not trying to insult you OP, I'm just going to state facts and then try to provide an unbiased opinion at the end. This is what I saw:

1. This was a bronze 3 - silver 5 game.  Funny, the last thread I saw like this was too.  Once again I'll ignore this and move on, but I figured it was worth mentioning.
2. You were Leblanc mid and dealt slightly less than 4k damage over the duration of the game.  You did not get a single kill throughout the entire game, which ended in 24 minutes.  You also only died twice and you did get 2 assists.
3. You had a (full tank) support Wukong that dealt over twice as much damage as you, the assassin mid, over the course of the game.
4. Their Ekko dealt 15,778 damage and it wasn't even the most damage dealt in the game. *Your Shen did 18,382 damage to champions despite having 3 thousand less gold than Ekko at the end of the game.*
5. Your ADC was varus and he died a lot (7 times) but he also dealt considerably more damage than the enemy Ashe who ended with a perfect KDA of 4/0/5

So here's what I gather from this:

Looks like their bot lane won pretty hard.  Seems you didn't spend much time helping yours out, while the enemy Ekko got a lot of kills from Varus, Wukong, and Fiora.  You had 2 kill participation in a game with 10 kills total for your team on one of the most mobile and safest mids in the game. You also dealt the least amount of damage in the game despite them having 2 extremely squishy and defenseless targets (Ashe and Zyra).  

Based on the small amount of damage you did compared to other players with the same amount of gold as you, I would say you played too safely and didn't give it your all in fights - or you positioned poorly and weren't able to deal damage because you had to go onto the wrong target.  

Varus clearly gave it his all, and he died a lot because he was against a mobile assassin with bad peel (Zyra), but he did his fair share of damage and honestly probably did as well as Ashe given the circumstances.  Ashe should have died as many times as Varus due to your team having both a Fiora and a Leblanc, which she is incapable of dealing with on her own.

You seem like a pretty reasonable person based on how you write, but what makes you think that this game is an accurate representation that Ekko is overpowered in any way?  You lost lane and proceeded to play very poorly despite having plenty of targets on a very mobile and snowbally champion.  You CSed well enough so you were never stupidly behind in gold to a point of being useless, but you played like you were useless despite this.  A Shen with 6k gold dealt more damage over the course of a 24 minute game than an Ekko with 9k gold, and yet here we are in a thread that calls Ekko overpowered?

I appreciate the time you put into this post but you could have called me bad and said the same thing in 1 word without spending 15-ish minutes of your life breaking down why you think so. I honestly stopped reading about 20 words into when you said ELO and determined my opinion was worthless because I had a crap rank last season. 

Something like 70% of the player base is silver or below so saying that those opinions are some how worth less than the "elite" 30% is just well, I giggled.

I will not examine another word of any argument you can come up with until it uses numbers that aren't preceded by some bullshit about rank.

TTFN

Sigh...

I specifically stated that I would be ignoring your rank in my post almost immediately after I mentioned it.  It's worth mentioning because low ELO games tend to have a different dynamic than high ELO games.  I never for a moment discounted your opinion because of your rank.

If you aren't willing to learn from your mistakes then you'll never get better.  You really should try reading it again, you might learn something.  

By the way, some life advice - being so sensitive that you refuse to accept constructive criticism due to a perceived insult is going to set you back for your entire life.  You should be happy when there are people who take the time to point out your mistakes, because they may not be as apparent to you.

What defines an assassin is **how they function in a team.**

An Assassin is a champion whose kit is designed to focus on taking down targets in a team fight. They make someone vulnerable and go in for the kill. Generally, they go for Marksmen, Mages or Supports (or other Assassins), as these targets are usually easier to kill. They avoid tanks and extended fights for the most part.

Because this is their goal, assassins always have mobility and often have CC--although instant, targeted hard CC is considered taboo because of their design. They also tend to have some sort of personal defense tool and some AoE.

All of the archetypes have defined goals in a fight, as well as guaranteed and expected kit tools. The specifics of those tools vary from champion to champion--one assassin may use stealth while another uses untargetability for personal defense, for example--but these are the general parts of what makes an Assassin.
